intro: Malesherbia rugosa, commonly known as the rough malesherbia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rugose stems and showy, yellow flowers with prominent stamens. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Malesherbia rugosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
